divs: Sighting DetailsGlowing light with tail traveling West to East in a straight line for 30 secs! It appeared to break up or burn up to my East and break into pieces. My Estimate that it was first observed from my ground observation West of Carrollton, TX and broke up over Garland,TX. Started at 25 degrees to the West on horizon, past directly overhead and ended 30 degrees from the East horizon. Definitely the largest meteor I have ever seen lasting (to my eyes)30 secs and glowing red hot than exploding and going out. Most have been a huge meteor to last that long and make it so low into the atmosphere.
trends: There have been 25 other sightings in Plano
There were no other sightings in Plano on or around February 1st 2012
